<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Yes
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'SEGOE UI SYMBOL', SANS-SERIF">
	&#9744;
</FONT>
	&#160;&#160; No
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'SEGOE UI SYMBOL', SANS-SERIF">
	&#9746;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The aggregate market value of Common Stock held by non-affiliates of the registrant as of June 30, 2015, computed by reference to the closing price on that date was $11,852,000.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The number of shares outstanding of the registrant&#8217;s common stock at March 23, 2016, was 30,990,029.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 82.98%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 6.98%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	&#160;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 10.03%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF">

</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Certain statements contained in this Report that are not historical facts constitute forward-looking statements, within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995, and are intended to be covered by the safe harbors created by that Act. Reliance should not be placed on forward-looking statements because they involve known and unknown risks, uncertainties, and other factors, which may cause actual results, performance, or achievements to differ materially from those expressed or implied. Any forward-looking statement speaks only as of the date made. We undertake no obligation to update any forward-looking statements to reflect events or circumstances after the date on which they are made.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	These forward-looking statements are not guarantees of the future as there are a number of meaningful factors that could cause Venaxis&#8217; actual results to vary materially from those indicated by such forward-looking statements.&#160;&#160;These statements are based on certain assumptions made based on experience, expected future developments and other factors Venaxis believes are appropriate in the circumstances. Factors which could cause actual results to differ from expectations, many of which are beyond the control of Venaxis, include, but are not limited to, our ability to: successfully identify a new strategic opportunity following the termination of the definitive agreements and related transactions with Strand Life Sciences Private Limited and its shareholders and its U.S. subsidiary, negotiate a definitive agreement with such alternative target and, if applicable, obtain all necessary approvals, including shareholder approval, retain the necessary management team to advance the Company&#8217;s strategic process, overcome adverse changes in market conditions, maintain, obtain and enforce intellectual property rights, realize value of intangible assets&#160; and deal with general business conditions; and other factors referenced herein in &#8220;Risk Factors.&#8221;&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">

<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	1
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage4"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<A NAME="APPY_10K-123115_HTM_PART1">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</DIV>
<EFX_PART_I>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_I"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	PART I
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	ITEM 1.&#160;&#160;&#160; BUSINESS.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In this Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2015 (the &#8220;Annual Report&#8221;) we refer to Venaxis, Inc., a Colorado corporation, as &#8220;Venaxis,&#8221; the &#8220;Company,&#8221; &#8220;we,&#8221; &#8220;us&#8221; and &#8220;our.&#8221;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Overview
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Prior to early 2016, Venaxis&#174; was an in vitro diagnostic company that was focused on obtaining clearance from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (&#8220;FDA&#8221;) for and commercializing its blood-based test to serve as an adjunctive test in the diagnosis and treatment of acute appendicitis in children, adolescent, and young adults.&#160; Our current test, the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test, is a CE marked rapid blood test panel for aiding in identifying patients in the emergency department who are at low risk for acute appendicitis.&#160; We are not aware of any blood test that is cleared by the FDA to aid in ruling out appendicitis and are not aware of any competitors in this area.&#160; The
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test has not been cleared by the FDA despite our performance of clinical trials, including our pivotal clinical trial for the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test, which was completed in early 2014.&#160; The data demonstrated high sensitivity and high negative predictive value (&#8220;NPV&#8221;), similar to other adjunctive tests for other conditions currently in use by physicians.&#160; In March 2014, we submitted a de novo request to the FDA for the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 System.&#160; In June 2014, the FDA sent us an Additional Information (&#8220;AI&#8221;) request, which is typical of this type of submission.&#160; We were in communication with the FDA several times while gathering the responsive information. In December 2014, we filed a response as a submission amendment.&#160; On January 27, 2015, the FDA notified us that it had determined that the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test does not meet the criteria for market clearance as a class II device based upon data and information in our de novo submission and subsequent amendment.&#160; We engaged in a number of conversations with the FDA between January and October of 2015, and determined that we did not have the financial resources to advance development of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test to FDA clearance.&#160; By that time, we were well advanced in our pursuit of strategic alternatives for the Company, as further described below, and determined that it was prudent for us to attempt to monetize our appendicitis-related assets or partner with another company to further develop such assets.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Following the receipt of the FDA letter, Venaxis began to explore its strategic alternatives, which included continued pursuit of regulatory approval for the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY1
</FONT>
	Test, focusing its resources on the research and development of its
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2 product candidate and seeking other technologies and opportunities.&#160; During February and March 2015, Venaxis concentrated its efforts on working with the FDA and preparing additional information with respect to its
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2 products, but also began to seek diversification alternatives.&#160; As further described below, in October 2015 Venaxis entered into a non-binding letter of intent with Strand Life Sciences Private Limited (&#8220;Strand&#8221;) and, from October 2015 through January 2016 negotiated definitive agreements with Strand.&#160; Venaxis entered into a series of definitive agreements with Strand, its U.S. subsidiary, Strand Genomics, Inc. (&#8220;SGI&#8221;) and the shareholders of Strand on January 26, 2016. However, on March 11, 2016, Venaxis, Strand and SGI entered into a Mutual Termination Agreement to terminate such definitive agreements.&#160; The parties determined that the transactions contemplated by definitive agreements were not able to be completed timely, despite the parties&#8217; respective best efforts, and the continued uncertainty was negatively impacting the efforts of the parties to advance their respective businesses.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Following the recent termination of the Strand transaction, the Company has begun evaluating potential strategic alternatives. The Company expects, in the near term, to establish the primary criteria it will consider as it evaluates its next steps and strategic path forward with the goal of maximizing value for its shareholders. As a result of the current market trends and uncertainties, and&#160;the impact on many companies, management believes that there may currently be attractive opportunities available to the Company.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	2
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage5"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Recent Developments
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	As noted above, on January 26, 2016, Venaxis entered into a Master Agreement with Strand and SGI, and into a&#160;series of share sale and investment agreements with the holders of more than 90% of the Strand shares, and a subsidiary of Venaxis entered into an Asset Purchase Agreement with SGI.&#160; On March 11, 2016, Venaxis, Strand and SGI entered into a Mutual Termination Agreement to terminate these definitive agreements.&#160; Pursuant to the Mutual Termination Agreement, each of the parties was relieved of any obligations or responsibilities under the Master Agreement and other transaction agreements.&#160; Each of the parties remains responsible for its respective transaction-related costs.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	On February 25, 2016, we completed the sale of our corporate headquarters, land and building, to a third party at a purchase price of $4,053,000.&#160; The sale generated approximately $1.7 million in net cash after expenses and mortgage payoffs. In addition to agreeing to the sale, we will lease back space in the building under short-term lease agreements that provide office and storage space required for our current level of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Following our decision to monetize our appendicitis-related assets, coupled with declining sales levels of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 products in the European Union (&#8220;EU&#8221;) well below break-even, and in order then to advance in the Strand transaction, we decided in early 2016 to begin winding down the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 commercial activities in the EU.&#160; We have informed our distributors of our decision to exit the appendicitis business and provided termination notices under our distribution agreements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Pursuit of Strategic Alternatives
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The strategic alternatives that we began to explore in early 2015 included continued pursuit of regulatory approval for the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY1
</FONT>
	Test, focusing our resources on the research and development of our
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2 product candidate and seeking other technologies and opportunities.&#160; During February and March 2015, we concentrated our efforts on working with the FDA and preparing additional information with respect to our
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2 products, but also began to seek diversification alternatives.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	During the first quarter of 2015, management conducted an early assessment of companies with point of care (&#8220;POC&#8221;), diagnostic or CLIA &#8211;based platforms and/or product offerings in development or early commercialization that could present potential strategic combination, licensure or joint venture opportunities for Venaxis.&#160; Some considerations included the regulatory approval status, potential menu expansion with
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2 and industry-based considerations.&#160; The board of directors authorized Venaxis&#8217; management, along with its advisors, to initiate more extensive strategic opportunity evaluations.&#160; Venaxis engaged a strategic advisor to assist the company in its search for suitable diagnostic companies to create value opportunities for shareholders.&#160; Management had developed a screening process focused on companies with commercial or near commercial launch status, capital efficiency, ability to complete a transaction, and product offerings in an industry where a significant market opportunity existed, followed by secondary screening criteria focused on addressable market and product or technology attributes, management and commercial capabilities and financial status.&#160; Venaxis and its advisors evaluated over 150 companies and approximately 28 companies were classified as high-interest based on the developed screening criteria.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	By the end of July 2015, Venaxis had narrowed its list to four potential targets, including Strand, and simultaneously continued due diligence while also discussing preliminary deal terms. By early September 2015, Venaxis had performed diligence on all four targets and exchanged non-binding term sheets with three of them.&#160; In September 2015, the Venaxis board of directors authorized management to focus on the transaction with Strand.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Strand is a privately-held, global genomics and bioinformatics company. It operates clinical reference labs in the U.S. through its wholly owned subsidiary SGI, and provides testing and lab services in India and other world-wide markets.&#160; Strand is commercializing a next generation sequencing (NGS) based, targeted, multi-gene, pan-cancer diagnostic panel in select international markets and has engaged in initial commercialization activities in the United States.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	3
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage6"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Over the summer of 2015, indications of interest were shared among the parties and initial transaction structures explored.&#160; Venaxis management met Strand management.&#160; A non-disclosure agreement was signed in early July 2015 and initial due diligence commenced.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	A non-binding term sheet was executed in October 2015.&#160; From October 2015 through mid-January 2016, the parties engaged in due diligence and negotiation of definitive agreements.&#160; Following receipt of approval from the holders of more than 90% of the Strand shares, plus the boards of Venaxis, Strand and SGI, the parties entered into a Master Agreement on January 26, 2016, Venaxis entered into a series of share sale and investment agreements with the Strand shareholders holding more than 90% of the Strand shares, and a subsidiary of Venaxis and SGI entered into an Asset Purchase Agreement.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Both Venaxis and Strand believed that, following consummation of the transactions, the combined company would:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="CA2F6648AC1D43CBB5247276E2ED8BBD" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 13.5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 22.5PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	have resources and management experience to support a more rapid commercialization launch for the Strand products in the U.S. and development of its pipeline of product candidates;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="0042A52639BD46AC98BD03B4B223FAC8" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 13.5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 22.5PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	provide access to the public U.S. markets to provide financing alternatives to Strand;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="442E669AF1DB4A5B9AA8F586A6B62894" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 13.5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 22.5PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	provide additional public company experience and diagnostic experience to Strand from the Venaxis management team and board of directors;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="7E56C743E0C14B8E8808BD769BC4A7AA" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 13.5PT">
</TD>

	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	increase potential to provide shareholder value to the legacy Venaxis and Strand shareholders;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="C7ACE651C29D45C48D141936F393F26F" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 13.5PT">
</TD>

	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	following the first closing contemplated by the definitive agreements, increase the combined company's visibility among both institutional and retail investors; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="6B67663498A348EB9E49266B999E8283" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 13.5PT">
</TD>

	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	potentially provide for other growth opportunities for the combined company with a public currency.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	On February 5, 2016, Venaxis filed a preliminary proxy statement with the SEC in connection with the Strand transaction.&#160; The SEC staff informed us that the preliminary proxy statement had been selected for a full review.&#160; The parties continued to work towards consummating the transactions while such review was going on, however, Venaxis, Strand and SGI determined that the transactions contemplated by the Master Agreement and other transaction agreements were not able to be completed timely, despite the parties&#8217; respective best efforts, and the continued uncertainty was negatively impacting the efforts of the parties to advance their respective business plans.&#160; Therefore, on March 11, 2016, they entered into the Mutual Termination Agreement. On March 14, 2016, the SEC was notified that the Strand transactions had been terminated.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Public Company Status
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Venaxis&#8217; common stock is registered under Section 12(b) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#8220;Exchange Act&#8221;).&#160; The Company files periodic and current reports in accordance the rules and regulations of the SEC.&#160; The Company&#8217;s common stock is listed on the NASDAQ Capital Market.&#160; On March 13, 2015, the Company received a letter from The NASDAQ Stock Market LLC ("NASDAQ") advising that for the previous 30 consecutive business days, the bid price of the Company's common stock had closed below the minimum $1.00 per share requirement for continued inclusion on the NASDAQ Capital Market pursuant to NASDAQ Marketplace Rule 5550(a)(2).&#160; NASDAQ stated in its letter that in accordance with NASDAQ Marketplace Rule 5810(c)(3)(A), the Company would be provided 180 calendar days, or until September 9, 2015, to regain compliance with the minimum bid price requirement.&#160; That compliance period was extended by NASDAQ for an additional 180 day period in September 2015.&#160; The Company did not regain compliance with the minimum bid price rule by March 8, 2016.&#160; On March 9, 2016, the Company received a letter from NASDAQ notifying the Company that the Company failed to comply with the NASDAQ Listing Rule 5810(b) and that the Company&#8217;s common stock was scheduled for delisting from the NASDAQ Capital Market at the opening of business on March 18, 2016, as a result of noncompliance with such Listing Rule and the Minimum Bid Price Rule during the prior 180-day period, unless the Company requested an appeal of such determination on or before March 16, 2016.&#160; The Company requested such appeal on March 12, 2016 and has a hearing with the NASDAQ Hearings Panel on April 21, 2016.&#160; The hearing request automatically stayed delisting of the Company&#8217;s common stock pending the Panel&#8217;s decision. There can be no assurance that the Company&#8217;s appeal will be successful. If the Company&#8217;s common stock is delisted, it may be eligible to continue to be quoted on an OTC Bulletin Board or in the &#8220;Pink Sheets.&#8221;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	4
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage7"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	On February 29, 2016, the Company mailed a definitive proxy statement to its shareholders seeking approval, at a Special Meeting, of a reverse stock split proposal.&#160; In such proxy statement, the board of directors seeks approval of a proposal to authorize the board of directors to effect, in its discretion (if the board of directors determines that a reverse stock split is in the best interests of the Company to maintain NASDAQ Capital Market listing), a reverse stock split of the outstanding shares of common stock in a ratio of at least one-for-four and of up to one-for-ten, to be determined by the board of directors, and, in connection with such reverse stock split, approve a corresponding amendment and restatement of the Company&#8217;s Articles of Incorporation, as amended, subject to the authority of the board of directors to abandon such amendment and restatement.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Special Meeting of Shareholders is scheduled for March 24, 2016, beginning at 3:00 p.m. local time, at the offices of the Company&#8217;s counsel, Ballard Spahr, LLP, in Denver Colorado.&#160; The Company believes that if the reverse stock split is approved and effectuated by the board of directors, and if the common stock closing price then closes above the $1.00 per share minimum bid price for 10 consecutive trading days prior to the NASDAQ hearing, the Company will be able to regain compliance with the applicable NASDAQ requirements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 System
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	We began product development of our blood-based appendicitis test in 2003, and conducted a number of clinical trials and other studies, which results have been described in our filings with the SEC.&#160; Following receipt of the FDA&#8217;s letter in January 2015, we had a number of conversations with FDA to discuss potential paths forward for our
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test.&#160; Venaxis management and advisors met with the FDA in June 2015 to discuss potential modifications to the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 product labeling as well as the possible gathering of additional clinical data which might support revised indications for use.&#160; Subsequent to that meeting, Venaxis, in conjunction with its advisors, developed revised indications for use for
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1, as well as a proposed plan for gathering additional clinical data to support the modified claims. The proposal included combining the results of the already completed clinical study, with additional new prospective patient samples from subjects to be enrolled under the new indications for use. The proposal also included a formal request for a meeting with the FDA. Venaxis submitted its revised proposed plan to the FDA on July 27, 2015, and a pre-submission meeting was scheduled for October 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	On October 1, 2015, we received comments from the FDA addressing our proposed plan and the revised indications for use for
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1.&#160; While the FDA was generally favorable to the revised indications for use that we had proposed, they did not agree that the retrospective samples (samples collected in our CP12 clinical trial conducted in 2013-2014) could be included in a revised study intended to validate the revised indications for use.&#160; Instead, the FDA indicated that we would be required to conduct a completely new prospective clinical study.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Based upon this advance written feedback from the FDA, and in light of management&#8217;s estimation of the significant time and resources necessary to complete such a study, we determined that the best use of the already scheduled meeting time with the FDA was to shift the focus of the meeting to the potential regulatory paths we could consider for the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2 assay.&#160; The meeting with the FDA to discuss
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2 was open and collaborative.&#160;&#160; The FDA framed their concerns around the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 performance and related claims and we discussed how we might provide indications for use on
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2, assuming the performance results of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2 in a future clinical trial would be similar to the performance results seen to-date.&#160; The FDA did indicate their commitment to a collaborative process going forward, including their commitment to assist us in the process of both the review of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2&#8217;s prospective study data, and with the appropriate labeling thereafter.&#160; However, before we could begin a new clinical trial, we would have needed to complete a full validation of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2 assay on a new instrument platform. Such work on developing a new platform with new assays was estimated to be very extensive in terms of time and resources. Therefore, we believed it was not prudent for Venaxis to advance with the appendicitis program as our primary business focus going forward, and have looked to monetize our appendicitis-related assets.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	We believe our appendicitis-related assets, including our samples, intellectual property and development assets described below, have value and can be used by a prospective purchaser, partner or licensor to complete the necessary development work to seek FDA clearance.&#160; We believe the main benefit of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 or
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2 products, if FDA-clearance can be secured, will be to provide the physician with objective information that will aid in the identification of patients at low risk for appendicitis and, thereby, potentially reduce the exposure to radiation from, and the expense associated with, the use of computed tomography (&#8220;CT&#8221;) scans that are currently performed on these patients.&#160; In addition, we believe the test can potentially save significant costs through improved patient throughput in emergency departments.&#160; To date, we have not identified a purchaser for our appendicitis-related assets.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	5
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage8"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The following is a description of our appendicitis-related assets, including a description of our 2014 pivotal clinical trial that led to our 510(k) clearance application submission.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Product Description and Development
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 System consists of a small fluorometer (
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	Reader&#174; Instrument) and consumable test products (
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	Reader QC Cassette,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Controls and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test).&#160; The
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	Reader&#174; Instrument measures fluorescence from the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test cassette and the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	Reader QC Cassette, the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	Reader QC Cassette ensures proper functioning of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	Reader&#174; Instrument and the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Controls ensure proper functioning of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test components.&#160; The
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test is explained in detail below.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	Test is a rapid blood test panel that combines the concentrations of three analytes, WBC, CRP and Venaxis&#8217; patented myeloid-related protein 8/14 (MRP 8/14, also known as S100A8/A9 or calprotectin) using a proprietary algorithm to provide a qualitative result to the physician to aid in the identification of patients at low risk for acute appendicitis.&#160; Plasma concentrations of MRP 8/14 and CRP are determined by an immunoassay and measured by the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	Reader&#174; Instrument, and the WBC value is obtained from the hospital&#8217;s hematology analyzer and entered by the user into the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	Reader&#174; Instrument.&#160; The proprietary algorithm uses the concentrations of MRP 8/14 and CRP as well as the WBC value to calculate an
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test result.&#160; These results are displayed on the display screen and are also included on a patient printout from the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	Reader&#174; Instrument.&#160; The test is designed to be run in approximately 20 minutes by trained laboratory personnel.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	A negative
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test result used in conjunction with other clinical information has the potential to aid the physician in patient evaluation and the identification of those who are at low risk for acute appendicitis, and subsequently, provide an opportunity to avoid radiation exposure.&#160; Additional potential benefits include helping physicians consider more conservative management with respect to acute appendicitis, facilitating more rapid disposition in a portion of pediatric patients that present with lower right quadrant abdominal pain consistent with acute appendicitis and reducing the duration of emergency department length of stay, a leading cause for emergency department overcrowding.&#160; Children, adolescents and young adults are of particular concern as they have the highest incidence of acute appendicitis and a heightened risk from radiation-induced cancer due to their young ages.&#160; The primary focus of our recent efforts has been directed toward obtaining U.S. regulatory clearance for the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test for children, adolescents and young adults.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In January 2014, we completed enrollment of the pivotal clinical study, enrolling 1,887 evaluable patients.&#160; In this population, the performance of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test demonstrated a negative predictive value of 97.3%, sensitivity of 96.9% and specificity of 37.8%. Prevalence of the disease in the pilot study was 25.3%.&#160; The
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	de novo
</FONT>
	request for the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test was submitted to the FDA in March 2014.&#160; The following
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test data summarize the results of the pivotal clinical study:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
