</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The clinical study data demonstrated high sensitivity and high negative predictive value similar to other adjunctive tests for other conditions currently in use by physicians.&#160; These performance attributes should provide the physician with incremental diagnostic information that we believe will enhance their decision-making process.&#160; The potential value of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test is its ability to aid a physician in his or her evaluation, allowing a more conservative evaluation and treatment path.&#160; Clinicians interviewed have indicated that this performance would be helpful to them in managing patients suspected for appendicitis.&#160; Based on such interviews, the physicians expressed that use of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test would assist in the evaluation of potential appendicitis and decrease their overall use of CT scans.&#160; Although CT scans are a widely used diagnostic tool in the U.S., the results are subject to interpretation and can be inconclusive.&#160; In addition, use of CT scans increases the risk to the patients by subjecting them to large doses of radiation.&#160; Over the past decade there has been increasing concern identified in many published studies regarding the radiation exposure caused by radiologic tests.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	6
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage9"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Product Development Activities
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	We refer to our next generation product development efforts as
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2.&#160; Our goal was to develop
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2 with the high sensitivity shown by the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test, but with increased specificity, which would allow us to potentially enhance our clinical claims.&#160; Additionally, we believe expanding the indication for
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2 to include adults in addition to pediatric and adolescent patients, could expand the market potential of the product.&#160; The primary reasons why we believe
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2 can be successfully developed are:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="6735689ADBD4423CA737F50ABDDA9F2D" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	First, we have collected more than 2,500 plasma samples from patients who presented at hospitals with abdominal pain with suspected appendicitis.&#160; In addition to the samples, we have extensive clinical information on these patients.&#160; We believe we possess the largest sample bank of its kind in the world.&#160; These samples are critical for biomarker discovery.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="64DF76D2FE5A4D8FB4BBEDE78FC2D086" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Second, we have engaged a leading protein biomarker discovery company, SomaLogic, Inc., to perform extensive screening on target protein markers, which would form the basis of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2 assay.&#160; The early work has yielded some very promising results, and we look forward to advancing this work and honing in on a panel of biomarkers for the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2 assay.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	APPY1 Commercialization and Marketing
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In January 2013, following completion of the steps required for a conformity mark under the European Economic Area (CE marking), we obtained CE marking in Europe for the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 System.&#160; We began advancing on commercialization and marketing activities of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test in the European Union, employing the clinical data gathered to date.&#160; During the initial launch phase, key market development activities included working to identify and sign collaboration agreements with key opinion leader hospitals for the purpose of completing well-defined outcome studies.&#160; The studies were designed to further demonstrate the clinical utility and economic value of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test in Europe.&#160; Based upon the positive results of the initial launch phase efforts during 2013, we moved into the second phase of the EU launch, a full-scale distribution and sales effort for the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test.&#160;&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In early 2014, we signed long-term distribution agreements with EMELCA Bioscience covering the Benelux Territories and with Laboratories Rubio covering Spain.&#160; In early 2015, we replaced EMELCA Bioscience with a long-term distribution agreement with The Surgical Company BV covering the Benelux Territories.&#160;In March 2015, we signed a long-term distribution agreement with SEBAC, (associated with The Surgical Company), covering France.&#160; In June 2015 Cremascoli &amp; Iris S.r.l. signed a long-term distribution agreement with Venaxis covering Italy.&#160; These agreements contain minimum annual revenue thresholds as well as product pricing terms that meet our targeted levels.&#160; During 2015 we continued to advance market development activities and having discussions with prospective distributors in other major EU markets.&#160; To support these efforts, we had engaged an EU based managing director to assist in the sales and marketing efforts outside of the U.S.&#160; Given our decision to monetize our appendicitis-related assets, in early 2016 we notified our distributors that we were not pursing the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 product offerings, and we provided notices to terminate the distribution agreements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In February 2015, we filed to expand our current CE mark for the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test to include adult patients in addition to children and adolescents.&#160; We were able to achieve this expanded certification based on an evaluation of the performance of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test in several hundred adult subject samples, which were collected and analyzed in late 2014.&#160; The
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test assay demonstrated sensitivity of 97.5%, negative predictive value of 98.4%, and specificity of 36.5% in these adult patients, which was very comparable to the results in children and adolescents.&#160; By adding the adult claim in the export market, we increased the market potential for the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test in the EU.&#160; We estimate that by adding the adult indication the total market potential for
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 testing could increase by as much as three times in the EU.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Following our decision to monetize our appendicitis-related assets, coupled with declining sales levels of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 products in the EU well below break-even, and in order to advance in the Strand transaction, we decided in early 2016 to begin winding down the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 commercial activities in the EU.&#160; We have informed our distributors and the EU managing director of our decision to exit the appendicitis business and provided termination notices under our corresponding agreements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	7
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage10"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Acute Appendicitis
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Acute appendicitis is a rapidly progressing condition which typically causes lower abdominal pain to increase over a period of 12 to 48 hours from onset of symptoms to perforation.&#160; This progressive pain period is variable, however, and can be sustained for 48 hours or more.&#160; Failure to accurately diagnose and treat acute appendicitis before perforation can lead to serious complications and, in some cases, death.&#160; The current diagnostic and treatment paradigm for acute appendicitis includes many factors, such as a review of the patient&#8217;s clinical presentation including signs and symptoms, health history, blood chemistry, temperature and white blood cell count.&#160; In the United States, patients who are considered to be at risk for acute appendicitis are frequently sent for CT or ultrasound imaging for further diagnosis and then surgery, if indicated.&#160; Misdiagnosis of acute appendicitis can lead not only to unnecessary surgery but also to the delay of proper therapy for the actual underlying condition.&#160; Physicians also face the dilemma of minimizing the negative appendectomy surgery rate without increasing the incidence of a life threatening perforation among patients presenting with symptoms of suspected acute appendicitis.&#160; Unfortunately, imaging-based methods and interpretations can be inconclusive or lead to an inaccurate or inconclusive diagnoses.&#160; To date, there appears to be no individual sign, symptom, test, or procedure capable of providing either a conclusive rule-in or rule-out diagnosis of acute appendicitis.&#160; Although CT scans are a widely used diagnostic tool in the United States,&#160;their results are subject to interpretation and can be inconclusive in addition to subjecting patients to potentially harmful radiation.&#160; Over the past decade there has been increasing concern over radiation exposure caused by imaging.&#160; In 2010, the FDA released a report titled &#8220;Initiative to Reduce Unnecessary Radiation Exposure from Medical Imaging.&#8221;&#160; We believe that the risks highlighted in reports such as this FDA Report could have positive implications for a test like the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test which, if cleared, could be used to help physicians determine which patients are at low risk for the disease and potentially avoid CT scanning.&#160; We expect the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test will provide an additional objective tool to assist physicians in their initial clinical evaluation of patients with acute abdominal pain indicative of acute appendicitis.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	It is estimated that approximately 5-7% of the population will be diagnosed with appendicitis in their lifetime, with the peak age range for the disease being the early teens.&#160; Published data from several sources indicate that in the United States, 3-15% of appendectomies remove a normal appendix due primarily to incorrect diagnosis prior to surgery.&#160; In addition to health risks, hospital charges for unnecessary (negative) appendectomies are estimated to cost approximately $740 million annually in the United States alone.&#160; Acute appendicitis is one of the leading causes of medical malpractice claims in the United States due to many factors, including high diagnostic error rates, negative appendectomies and increased cost and complications in cases where the appendix perforates.&#160; Diagnosing patients presenting with abdominal pain remains one of the most common and challenging conditions in emergency medicine.&#160; Based on the EU Market Study that we conducted in 2012, results indicated that 10% of the over 217 million patients that visited European and U.S. hospital emergency departments in 2010 had the primary complaint of abdominal pain.&#160; The study also showed that appendicitis had the highest incidence in patients 10-19 years of age.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The rate of negative appendectomy is thought to be impacted by the use of CT scans in that such rates are considerably higher in places that do not use CT scans.&#160; In the U.S. alone, according to National Hospital Ambulatory Medical Care Survey data from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), in 2009 there were approximately 9.6 million patients who entered emergency departments complaining of abdominal pain.&#160; Out of this total, 6.6 million had CBC work-ups, which includes WBC count, 3.2 million underwent CT imaging studies and 1.2 million underwent ultrasound procedures.&#160; Approximately 280,000 of these total patients were diagnosed as having acute appendicitis and underwent appendectomies.&#160; Included in these totals were 2.1 million patients (approximately 21%) who were children, adolescents and young adults aged 2 to 20.&#160; Out of this sub-population, 1.1 million had CBC work-ups performed, 417,000 underwent CT imaging and 259,000 underwent ultrasound procedures.&#160; Approximately 100,000 of this group of patients were diagnosed as having acute appendicitis and underwent appendectomies.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Acute appendicitis most frequently occurs in patients aged 10 to 30, but can affect all ages.&#160; Using a CT scan to rule out acute appendicitis can be particularly difficult in children and young adults because many patients in these age groups have low body fat resulting in poor tissue differentiation or contrast on the CT scan.&#160; The
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test has the potential to enhance overall safety by reducing the amount of radiation exposure from unnecessary CT scans for those patients at low risk for having acute appendicitis.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Results from our development efforts, clinical trials and pilot trials performed to date indicate that the greatest benefit of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test would be in aiding the physician in the evaluation of those patients at low risk for having acute appendicitis.&#160; We believe that the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test has the potential to enhance the effectiveness and speed of patient evaluation and improve the standard of care for low-risk patients.&#160; We anticipate that if the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test is cleared by the FDA, it will be incorporated in routine testing as a patient&#8217;s blood sample is taken in the ordinary course of an initial assessment of the patient entering the emergency department setting when the physician suspects appendicitis but considers the patient at low risk for the disease.&#160; The
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test is intended to cost-effectively help the physician determine if a patient is at a low risk for acute appendicitis.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	APPY1 System Raw Materials and Suppliers
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Our
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 System products include a reader instrument (
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	Reader) and the consumable test products consisting of test cassettes, controls and packaging.&#160; The
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	Reader has been manufactured for us by a well-established vendor based in Germany.&#160; All of our readers were shipped to our facility for final testing and release prior to shipment to customers and clinical trial sites.&#160; Consumable test product components have been manufactured at the Venaxis facility.&#160; Raw materials and certain sub-components are acquired from a number of suppliers.&#160; All significant vendors are qualified based upon a quality review, which may also include on-site quality audits.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	8
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage11"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Animal Healthcare
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Effective May 1, 2004, we entered into an exclusive license agreement (WU License Agreement) with Washington University in St. Louis (WU), which granted us an exclusive license and right to sublicense WU&#8217;s technology (as defined under the WU License Agreement) for veterinary products worldwide, except where such products are prohibited under U.S. laws for export.&#160; The term of the WU License Agreement continues until the expiration of the last of WU&#8217;s patents (as defined in the WU License Agreement).&#160; We have agreed to pay minimum annual royalties of $20,000 during the term of the WU License Agreement and such amounts are creditable against future royalties and other payments.&#160; Royalties payable to WU under the WU License Agreement for covered product sales by us, directly or indirectly, carry a mid-single-digit royalty rate and for sublicense fees received by us&#160;carry a low double-digit royalty rate.&#160; The WU License Agreement contains customary terms for confidentiality, prosecution and infringement provisions for licensed patents, publication rights, indemnification and insurance coverage.&#160; The WU License Agreement is cancelable by us with ninety days advance notice at any time and by WU with sixty days advance notice if we materially breach the WU License Agreement and fail to cure such breach in a designated period.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In July 2012, we entered into an exclusive license agreement (License Agreement) with Ceva Sant&#233; Animale S.A. (Licensee), under which we granted the Licensee an exclusive royalty-bearing license to our intellectual property and other assets, including patent rights and know-how, relating to recombinant single chain reproductive hormone technology for use in non-human mammals (Animal Health Assets).&#160; The License Agreement includes a sublicense of the technology licensed to us by WU and a license to the assets acquired from Novartis under the Termination Agreement described below.&#160; Under the terms of the WU License Agreement, a portion of the license fees and royalties we receive from&#160;sublicensing agreements will be paid to WU.&#160; Under the License Agreement, the Licensee obtained a worldwide exclusive license to develop, seek regulatory approval for and offer to sell, market, distribute, import and export luteinizing hormone (LH) and/or follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) products for bovine (cattle), equine and swine in the field of the assistance and facilitation of reproduction in bovine, equine and swine animals.&#160; We also granted the Licensee an option and right of first refusal to develop additional animal health products outside of the licensed field of use or any diagnostic pregnancy detection tests for non-human mammals.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Intellectual Property
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Further enhancement and expansion of our proprietary patent position is ongoing with respect to the scope of protection for Venaxis&#8217; first generation and future generation versions of tests.&#160; Strong scientific and technical progress remains the basis for these innovative efforts.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	APPY1 Intellectual Property
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Beginning in 2004, we initiated the establishment of an intellectual property portfolio for the acute appendicitis testing technology and products that have been used in the development of the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test.&#160; We have filed for and are pursuing extensive patent coverage related to several aspects of the initial discovery and various test applications.&#160; Further enhancement and expansion of our proprietary patent position is ongoing with respect to the scope of protection for our first generation and future generation versions of the test.&#160; Scientific and technical progress remains the basis for these efforts.&#160; In March 2009, the United States Patent and Trademark Office issued our patent directed to methods relating to our appendicitis diagnostic technology.&#160; This patent, No. 7,501,256 (expires February 7, 2026), is entitled &#8220;Methods and Devices for Diagnosis of Appendicitis.&#8221;&#160; Additional U.S. patents, No. 7,659,087 and No. 7,670,769, were issued on February 9, 2010 and March 2, 2010, respectively (both expiring July 25, 2025).&#160; At this time, patents have been issued in the following foreign countries: Australia, Hong Kong, Israel, Japan, New Zealand, Singapore and South Africa.&#160; A patent was also granted by the European Patent Office and subsequently validated in the following European countries: Belgium, Switzerland, Germany, Spain, France, the United Kingdom, Ireland, Italy, the Netherlands and Sweden.&#160; In late 2014, we were notified that the Canadian patent applications have been allowed and the patent will grant in 2015.&#160;On March 24, 2015 Canadian patent 2,574,991 was granted.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In late 2012, additional U.S. utility and patent cooperation treaty (PCT) patent applications were filed for the appendicitis testing technology and products.&#160; The patent filings focus on the newly developed multiple-marker technology, providing patent coverage for using the MRP 8/14 levels in a given sample in conjunction with CRP levels and WBC count among a number of other evaluated marker combinations in order to provide an increasingly robust test to aid in the management of low risk patients suspicious for appendicitis.&#160; Additionally, the patent filings claim a method for ruling out appendicitis based on multiple markers, a device or system for assessing a subject based on a plurality of markers, and a kit or device to determine the value of a biomarker in a given sample.&#160; Currently, these filings are in application phase and not yet granted in any specific countries.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In May 2003, we entered into an Assignment and Consultation Agreement (the Bealer Agreement) with Dr. John Bealer.&#160; The Bealer Agreement transferred to us ownership rights from Dr. Bealer for inventions and related improvements to technology associated with human appendicitis diagnostics involving protein antigens.&#160; The consideration for the Bealer Agreement was the payment of a future royalty to Dr. Bealer based upon a low double digit rate applied to revenues, all as defined under the Bealer Agreement.&#160; The Bealer Agreement contained confidentiality provisions, provided for the assignment of all patent rights to us (which has occurred) and restrictions on the assignability of the agreement.&#160; The Bealer Agreement continued for the longer of twenty years or the expiration of the last of our applicable patents to expire.&#160; We had the right to terminate the Bealer Agreement if we, in our reasonable judgment, decide we have no interest in pursuing the opportunity as defined under the agreement.&#160; On January 7, 2015, Venaxis received a complaint, captioned Dr. John F. Bealer, a resident of Arapahoe County, individually v. Venaxis, Inc., a Colorado corporation, Case No. 2015CV30022.&#160; This action was filed in the Arapahoe County District Court and subsequently transferred to Douglas County District Court.&#160; The complaint included allegations of breach of contract pertaining to the financial provisions of the Bealer Agreement.&#160; In December 2015, the parties to the litigation settled the litigation, without any admission of liability, with payment of an undisclosed sum to Dr. Bealer. In connection with the settlement the Bealer Agreement was terminated.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	9
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">

</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage12"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Animal Health
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Our animal health patent portfolio originated under the exclusive license agreement with WU, under which we obtained intellectual property rights to WU&#8217;s patent estate.&#160; This extensive portfolio consists of both patents and pending patent applications (approximately 25 patents and numerous patent applications) related to our animal health products under development.&#160; The term of the WU License Agreement ends upon the expiration of the last patent to expire.&#160; Patents in the estate have expiration dates ranging from 2010 to 2019.&#160; WU has filed, and continues to file, patent applications to expand and extend the patent coverage of the WU technology.&#160; We reimburse WU for the costs of such patent filings, namely prosecution and maintenance fees.&#160; Additional patents in the animal health portfolio have been filed by us outside of the WU License Agreement.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	A patent filing for the recombinant luteinizing hormone technology was submitted in 2004, entitled &#8220;Methods and Kits for Maintaining Pregnancy, Treating Follicular Cysts, and Synchronizing Ovulation Using Luteinizing Hormone.&#8221;&#160; This patent family claims methods of administering rLH, the timing of administration, and dosage given in order to increase formation of accessory corpora lutea and maintain pregnancies in treated animals.&#160; To date, four foreign patents have been granted for &#8220;Methods and Kits for Maintaining Pregnancy, Treating Follicular Cysts, and Synchronizing Ovulation Using Luteinizing Hormone,&#8221; New Zealand patent 542549 was granted March 12, 2009 (expiring March 2024), Australia 2004218365 was granted May 27, 2010 (expiring March 2024), European patent 1610803 was granted December 15, 2010 (expiring March 2024) and Canadian patent 2518268 was granted December 10, 2013 (expiring March 2024).&#160; The patent granted by the European Patent Office and has been validated in the following countries: Belgium, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, Switzerland and the United Kingdom.&#160; Currently, there are additional foreign patent applications that are in prosecution.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	A patent filing for the recombinant bovine follicle stimulating hormone technology was submitted in 2008, entitled &#8220;Compositions and Methods Including Expression and Bioactivity of Bovine Follicle Stimulating Hormone.&#8221;&#160; This patent family claims the rbFSH single-chains itself, as well as methods of administering rbFSH, the timing of administration, and dosage given in order to increase reproduction, induce superovulation or increase embryo production in ungulates.&#160; The patent family includes filings in the following countries: Argentina, Australia, Canada, New Zealand, Thailand and the United States.&#160; The patent has also been filed with the European Patent Office.&#160; In October of 2011, the first patent in this family was granted by the European Patent Office (2134165), expiring October 12, 2028.&#160; The patent has also been granted in New Zealand (579740), expiring October 1, 2028.&#160; Following the grant of the patent in 2011 by the European Patent Office, the patent was validated in the following countries: France, Germany, Italy and the Netherlands.&#160; In August 2013, the patent was granted in the United States (8518881 B2) expiring February 8, 2028, followed in November 2013 by the grant in Australia (2008213567) expiring February 8, 2028.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	A patent filing for the equine follicle stimulating hormone technology was filed in 2008, entitled &#8220;Activity of Recombinant Equine Follicle Stimulating Hormone.&#8221;&#160; This patent family provides coverage for the single chain eFSH itself, methods of administering reFSH, the timing of administration, and dosage given in order to increase reproductive activity in treated animals.&#160; The first patent in the patent family was granted in China in April 2013 (200880123523.8) expiring November 28, 2028.&#160; The U.S. Patent for this family was granted in September 2014 (8,835,386) expiring November 28, 2028. The patent was granted for Canada (2,685,437) on June 2, 2015 and will expire February 8, 2028. Currently, there are additional foreign patent applications that are in prosecution.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Two separate patent applications relating to cattle pregnancy have been filed by us.&#160; A patent filing for the Bovine Pregnancy test technology was filed in 2007, entitled &#8220;Bovine Pregnancy Test.&#8221;&#160; This patent family provides coverage for an assay device designed to detect pregnancy, the specific specifications of the device, for the antibodies used in the assay, as well as the type of sample used and the species for which the test is effective in detecting pregnancy.&#160; The parent application was granted in the United States in 2008 (No. 7,393,696 expiring May 30, 2025), with the divisional application granted in 2010 (No. 7,687,281 expiring May 6, 2023).&#160; Additionally, a patent filing for pregnancy detection was filed in 2003, entitled &#8220;Pregnancy Detection.&#8221;&#160; This patent family provides coverage for an immunoassay test device, the specific specifications of the device, and for the antibodies used in the assay as well as the type of sample used.&#160; The patent has been issued in the following counties: Australia (No. 2003243199), New Zealand (No. 536229 &amp; 572488), and the United States (No. 7,842,513), each of which expires on May 2, 2023.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	General Operations
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Backlog and Inventory
</FONT>
	&#8212; We do not expect that the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 System products business will be seasonal in nature.&#160; We have developed and identified reliable sources of raw material and components for the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 System products and currently do not expend large amounts of capital to maintain inventories of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 System products.&#160; Currently there is no back-log of orders.&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	10
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage13"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Payment Terms
</FONT>
	&#8212; For the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test, we did not provide extended payment terms, other than to support certain new product introductions, and then with terms of no more than 45-60 days.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Revenues
</FONT>
	&#8212; During the year ended December 31, 2015, three European-based customers accounted for total net sales, each representing 52%, 26% and 22%, respectively.&#160; During the year ended December 31, 2014, two European-based customers accounted for total net sales, each representing 89% and 11%, respectively.&#160; At December 31, 2015 and 2014, Venaxis did not have any accounts receivable.&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Research and Development
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	We expended approximately $2,159,000 on total research and development in 2015, and $4,035,000 in 2014.&#160; In 2015, we completed all development work we intend to pursue related to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2.&#160; The Licensee conducts all research and development activities with respect to the animal health assets.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Regulatory Matters
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	FDA
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The FDA has regulatory marketing authority in the United States over our
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 System. Venaxis operated under 21 CFR Part 820 regulations (U.S.) and ISO13485 standards (EU) for cGMP manufacturing of medical devices.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The FDA&#8217;s Center for Devices and Radiological Health (CDRH) is responsible for regulating firms who manufacture, repackage, re-label and/or import medical devices sold in the United States.&#160; Medical devices are classified into Class I, II and III.&#160; In-vitro diagnostic medical devices are regulated by the CDRH Office of In-vitro Diagnostic Devices and Radiological Health (OIR).&#160; Our
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 Test was anticipated to be classified as a non-invasive Class II medical device by the FDA, requiring a
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	de novo
</FONT>
	submission.&#160; Generally, FDA product clearance for diagnostic products is granted after specific clinical trials, analytical testing and demonstrated compliance to performance standards has been achieved to the agency&#8217;s satisfaction.&#160; There is no assurance that FDA clearance will be obtained to market the acute appendicitis test.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Any product clearances (or approvals) that are granted remain subject to continual FDA review, and newly discovered or developed safety or efficacy data may result in withdrawal of products from the market.&#160; Moreover, if and when such clearance is obtained, the manufacture and marketing of such products remain subject to extensive regulatory requirements administered by the FDA and other regulatory bodies, including compliance with current GMP, adverse event reporting requirements and the FDA&#8217;s general prohibitions against promoting products for unapproved or &#8220;off-label&#8221; uses.&#160; Manufacturers are subject to inspection and post-market surveillance by the FDA for compliance with these regulatory requirements.&#160; Failure to comply with the requirements can, among other things, result in warning letters, product seizures, recalls, fines, injunctions, suspensions or withdrawals of regulatory approvals, operating restrictions and civil or criminal prosecutions.&#160; Any such enforcement action could have a material adverse effect on our business.&#160; Unanticipated changes in existing regulatory requirements or the adoption of new requirements could also have a material adverse effect on our business.&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	European Regulations
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In the European Union, in-vitro diagnostic (IVD) medical devices are regulated under EU-Directive 98/79/EC (IVD Directive), and related provisions.&#160; The IVD Directive requirements include provisions for the design, manufacture, distribution and post-market surveillance of IVDs to assure the safety and efficacy of the devices.&#160; According to the IVD Directive, manufacturers must attest to compliance with certain essential requirements with respect to devices which are in conformity with relevant national standards and harmonized standards which have been published in the Official Journal of the European Communities.&#160; These harmonized standards include ISO 14971, risk management and ISO 13485, the quality standard for medical device manufacturers.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	IVD medical devices must bear the CE marking of conformity when they are placed on the market.&#160; The CE mark is a declaration by the manufacturer that the product meets all the appropriate provisions and essential requirements outlined in the European IVD Directive.&#160; As a general rule, the manufacturer must follow the procedure of the EC Declaration of conformity to obtain this CE marking.&#160; Each European country must adopt its own laws, regulations and administrative provisions necessary to comply with the IVD Directive.&#160; In January 2013, we obtained CE marking for the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 System.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Environmental Protection
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	We are subject to various environmental laws pertaining to the disposal of hazardous medical waste.&#160; We contract for disposal of our hazardous waste with a licensed disposal facility.&#160; We do not expect to incur liabilities related to compliance with environmental laws; however, we cannot make a definitive prediction.&#160; The costs we incur in disposal of hazardous waste have not been significant.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>

	11
</DIV>

<EFX_PROPERTIES>
<A NAME="FIS_PROPERTIES"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Properties
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	We maintain our administrative office, laboratory and production operations in a 40,000 square foot building in Castle Rock, Colorado, which was constructed for us in 2003. In February 2016 we completed the sale of our corporate headquarters land and building to a third party, as further disclosed below.&#160; The Company believes that its facilities are adequate for its near-term needs.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	On February 25, 2016, we completed the sale of our corporate headquarters land and building to a third party at a purchase price of $4,053,000.&#160; The sale generated approximately $1.7 million in net cash after expenses and mortgage payoffs. In addition to agreeing to the sale, we will lease back space in the building under short term lease agreements that provide office and storage space required for our current level of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Other Laws
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	We are also subject to other federal, state and local laws, pertaining to matters such as safe working conditions and fire hazard control.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Glossary of Terms
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Algorithm &#8212;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	a set of rules that precisely defines a sequence of operations, and, in the case of APPY1, such a set of rules using mathematical computation in a software program.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Biomarker tests &#8212;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	tests that identify and quantify markers associated with disease or medical conditions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Complete Blood Count (CBC) &#8212;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	a blood test used to evaluate overall health and detect a wide range of disorders, including anemia, infection and leukemia.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	CRP &#8212;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	C-reactive protein, a protein produced in the liver and found in the blood, the levels of which rise in response to inflammation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	De Novo
</FONT>
	Classification
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#8211; a mechanism defined by the FDA Modernization Act (Section 513(f)) for classifying new medical devices for which there is no predicate, providing the product with a risk-based Class II classification allowing clearance as a 510(k).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	ELISA (Enzyme Linked Immunosorbant Assay) &#8212;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	immunological method used to test a sample for a protein marker.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	cGMP &#8212;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	FDA current Good Manufacturing Practice.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Immunoassay-based &#8212;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	test that uses antibody-antigen interaction as method of measure.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Multi-marker test &#8212;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	a diagnostic or other test that uses multiple protein biomarkers as part of a diagnostic test panel.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Recombinant &#8212;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Novel DNA made by genetic engineering.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	WBC &#8212;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	White blood cell count. The white blood cells are analyzed from a blood sample collected as part of a standard protocol for patients suspected of having infections who have entered the emergency department of a hospital.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	12
</DIV>

<EFX_RISK_FACTORS>
<A NAME="FIS_RISK_FACTORS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<A NAME="APPY_10K-123115_HTM_ITEM1A">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	ITEM 1A. &#8212; RISK FACTORS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	If any of the following risks actually occur, they could materially adversely affect our business, financial condition or operating results. In that case, the trading price of our common stock could decline.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Risks Related to Our Business
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	We may not be successful in the pursuit of a strategic alternative.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Following termination of the Strand transactions, management promptly turned its attention to an evaluation of other strategic alternatives available to us.&#160; As of February 29, 2016, we have approximately $17,800,000 in cash, cash equivalents, and investments, and we hope to maintain our NASDAQ Capital Market listing as described below under &#8220;Risks Related to our Securities.&#8221;&#160; We may not be successful in identifying and successfully negotiating a transaction with another target company, as merger and acquisition transactions are highly uncertain of success, or obtaining shareholder approval of any such transaction.&#160; If we are not able to identify, negotiate and consummate a transaction with another company, we will be unable to continue our business and may need to dissolve.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	We may be unable to monetize or support our other assets (appendicitis and animal health) on a timely basis or at all, which could distract management&#8217;s attention from the core pursuit of exploring strategic alternatives, and could have a negative impact on our financial condition.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	We intend to attempt to monetize the legacy Venaxis appendicitis portfolio and support our animal health assets to maximize liquidity.&#160; We may not be successful in such endeavors, could realize less than we anticipate in the disposition or support of such assets, could incur unanticipated costs in such disposition activities and may need to shut down such legacy businesses without realizing any value from such legacy assets.&#160; In any such event, our financial condition could be negatively impacted.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The legacy Venaxis shareholders will likely experience significant dilution of their ownership in any strategic transaction.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	We anticipate that any strategic transaction will involve the issuance of our securities, which could have a signification dilutive effect on the percentage ownership of our current shareholders.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Advancing on or failure to complete a strategic transaction could likely materially adversely affect Venaxis.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Venaxis will be subject to significant costs, including legal, accounting and advisory fees related to any strategic transaction, which must be paid even if a transaction is not ultimately consummated.&#160; To date Venaxis has incurred costs of approximately $1,250,000 associated with the terminated Strand transaction.&#160; Venaxis cannot make any assurance that a future strategic transaction will occur on commercially reasonable terms or at all.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	We have not been able to generate sufficient sales of our products in the European Union countries or elsewhere outside of the U.S. and have commenced the wind down of our European business.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	We obtained CE marking for our
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 System products in January 2013 and launched commercialization and marketing activities in the EU.&#160; Our strategy was to leverage the experience of key opinion leaders in select hospitals in order to generate additional meaningful, multinational field data for
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 System products and leverage successful data into relationships with distributors in the identified target countries.&#160; We had limited initial commercial success in the EU and, following the FDA decision in January 2015, have not been able to grow revenues without FDA clearance. In February 2016 we commenced actions to shut down our business in the EU, including termination of our existing distribution and employment agreements.&#160; We may incur costs associated with the wind down of our EU activities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	14
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage17"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	We may not achieve the anticipated revenue from the out-licensing of our animal health assets.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In 2012, we entered into an exclusive license agreement with a third party to license all of our animal health assets in return for license fees, milestone and royalty payments.&#160; If product development efforts using our animal health assets are not successful in achieving commercial products, we may not receive all anticipated milestone and royalty payments.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Our results of operations could be affected by our royalty payments due to third parties.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Any revenues from products under development will likely be subject to royalty payments under licensing or similar agreements. Major factors affecting these payments include, but are not limited to:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>

	our ability to achieve meaningful sales of our products;
</DIV>

</DIV>

	the achievement of milestones established in our license agreements; and
</DIV>
