</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage60"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	Independence of the Board of Directors
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Board of Directors currently consists of Ms. Schoettler, Drs. Evans and Williams and Messrs. Lundy, Faulkner and Welch.&#160; The Company defines &#8220;independent&#8221; as that term is defined in Rule 5605(a)(2) of the NASDAQ listing standards.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	For 2015, Ms. Schoettler and Messrs. Faulkner and Welch qualified as independent and none of them have any material relationship with the Company that might interfere with his or her exercise of independent judgment.&#160; In making the determination as to the independence of Mr. Faulkner, the Board considered the interim nature of his service as CEO of the Company for a brief period ending in March 2010, and his independence from the Company in all other respects.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The non-employee directors, with the exception of Ms. Schoettler, receive cash compensation of $1,000 per month as compensation for service on the Board.&#160; Ms. Schoettler, the non-executive Chair of the Board, receives compensation of $2,000 per month as compensation for service on the Board.&#160; The independent directors typically receive a stock option grant upon joining the Board and additional stock option grants, generally annually, for service on the Board.&#160; Effective October 2010, Ms. Schoettler began receiving equity awards equal to 1.5 times the amount granted to other non-employee directors when such awards are issued.&#160; The directors are also reimbursed for all expenses incurred by them in attending board and committee meetings.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	Board Leadership Structure and Role in Risk Management
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Board of Directors believes that separating the positions of Chair of the Board and Chief Executive Officer provides the best leadership structure for the Company at this time.&#160; Gail S. Schoettler serves as the non-executive Chair of the Board.&#160; Separating these positions allows the Chief Executive Officer to focus on the day-to-day business, while allowing the Chair to lead the Board of Directors in its fundamental role of providing advice to and independent oversight of management.&#160; The Board of Directors also believes that this structure ensures a greater role for the independent directors in the oversight of the Company and active participation of the independent directors in setting agendas and establishing priorities and procedures for the work of the Board of Directors.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Board of Directors is actively involved in oversight of risks that could affect the Company.&#160; This oversight is conducted primarily through committees of the Board of Directors, but the full Board of Directors has retained responsibility for general oversight of risks.&#160; The Board of Directors satisfies this responsibility through full reports by each committee chair regarding the committee&#8217;s considerations and actions, as well as through regular reports directly from officers responsible for management of particular risks within the Company.&#160; The Board of Directors believes that full and open communication between management and the Board of Directors is essential for effective risk management and oversight.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	Committees
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Audit Committee:
</FONT>
	The Company has a separately designated standing audit committee established in accordance with Section 3(a) (58) (A) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.&#160; Four of the Company&#8217;s directors serve on the Audit Committee &#8211; David E. Welch (who serves as Chair of the Audit Committee), Gail S. Schoettler, Daryl J. Faulkner and Stephen A. Williams.&#160; Mr.&#160;Welch has been designated as the financial expert on the Audit Committee.&#160; Each Audit Committee member meets the definition of independence for Audit Committee membership as required by the NASDAQ listing standards.&#160; The Amended and Restated Audit Committee Charter is available on our website at www.venaxis.com.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee
</FONT>
	.&#160; The Nominating Committee consists of Daryl J. Faulkner (who serves as Chair of the Nominating Committee), Susan A. Evans, Gail S. Schoettler and Stephen A. Williams, each of whom meet the NASDAQ listing standards for independence.&#160; Duties of the Nominating Committee include oversight of the process by which individuals may be nominated to our Board of Directors.&#160; The Nominating Committee charter is available on our web site at www.venaxis.com.&#160; There have been no material changes to the procedures by which security holders may recommend nominees to the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors.&#160; The specific process for evaluating new directors, including shareholder-recommended nominees, will vary based on an assessment of the then current needs of the Board and the Company.&#160; The Nominating Committee will determine the desired profile of a new director, the competencies they are seeking, including experience in one or more of the following: highest personal and professional integrity, demonstrated exceptional ability and judgment and who shall be most effective in conjunction with the other nominees to the Board, in collectively serving the long-term interests of the shareholders.&#160; Candidates will be evaluated in light of the target criteria chosen.&#160; The Nominating Committee does not have a formal diversity policy; however, in addition to the foregoing, it considers race and gender diversity in selection of qualified candidates.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	58
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage61"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Compensation Committee:
</FONT>
	&#160; The Company&#8217;s Compensation Committee is comprised of Susan A. Evans (who serves as Chair of the Compensation Committee), John H. Landon (until his retirement from the Board on June 1, 2015), Gail S. Schoettler and David E. Welch, each of whom is an independent director.&#160; The amended and restated Compensation Committee Charter is available on our website at www.venaxis.com.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Duties of the Compensation Committee include reviewing and making recommendations regarding compensation of executive officers and determining the need for and the appropriateness of employment agreements for senior executives.&#160; This includes the responsibility: (1) to determine, review and recommend to the Board for approval on an annual basis the corporate goals and objectives with respect to compensation for the senior executives, and (2) to evaluate at least once a year the performance of the senior executives in light of the established goals and objectives and, based upon these evaluations, to determine and recommend to the Board for approval the annual compensation for each, including salary, bonus, incentive and equity compensation.&#160; When evaluating the compensation of our executive officers, the Compensation Committee evaluates factors including the executive&#8217;s responsibilities, experience and the competitive marketplace.&#160; The Compensation Committee may also invite the senior executives and other members of management to participate in their deliberations, or to provide information to the Compensation Committee for its consideration with respect to such deliberations, except that the chief executive officer may not be present for the deliberation of or the voting on compensation for the chief executive officer.&#160; The chief executive officer may, however, be present for the deliberation of or the voting on compensation for any other officer.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Compensation Committee has authority to retain such compensation consultants, outside counsel and other advisors as the Compensation Committee in its sole discretion deems appropriate.&#160; The Compensation Committee did not retain any such advisor for 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Compensation Committee also has the authority and responsibility: (1) to review the fees paid to non-employee directors for service on the Board of Directors and its committees, and make recommendations to the Board with respect thereto; and (2) to review the Company&#8217;s incentive compensation and other stock-based plans and recommend changes in such plans to the Board as needed.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	Section 16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Section 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, requires the Company&#8217;s officers and directors and persons who own more than 10% of the Company&#8217;s outstanding Common Stock to file with the Securities and Exchange Commission (&#8220;SEC&#8221;) initial reports of ownership and reports of changes in ownership of Common Stock and any other equity securities of the Company. Directors, officers, and greater than 10% shareholders are required by SEC regulations to furnish the Company with copies of all Section 16(a) forms they file.&#160; To the Company&#8217;s knowledge, based solely on a review of Forms 3, 4 and 5, and amendments thereto furnished to the Company during and for the Company&#8217;s year ended December 31, 2015 and as of March 20, 2016, there were no directors, officers or more than 10% shareholders of the Company who failed to timely file a Form 3, 4 or 5.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	Code of Ethics and Whistle Blower Policy
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Our Code of Ethics which applies to the Company&#8217;s directors, executive officers and management employees generally is available on our website at www.venaxis.com.&#160; We intend to post any material amendments to or waivers of, our Code of Ethics that apply to our executive officers, on this website.&#160; In addition, our Whistle Blower Policy is available on our website at www.venaxis.com.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	59
</DIV>

	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<U>
	Communications with the Board of Directors
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Company values the views of its shareholders (current and future shareholders, employees and others).&#160; Accordingly, the Board of Directors established a system through its Audit Committee to receive, track and respond to communications from shareholders addressed to the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors.&#160; Any shareholder who wishes to communicate with the Board of Directors may write to:
</DIV>

<EFX_COMPENSATION>
<A NAME="FIS_COMPENSATION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	ITEM 11.&#160;&#160;EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Compensation Discussion and Analysis
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	This section describes our compensation program for our named executive officers during the fiscal year ended December 31, 2015.&#160; The following discussion focuses on our compensation program and compensation-related decisions for 2015 and also addresses why we believe our compensation program is appropriate for Venaxis.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Compensation philosophy and overall objectives of executive compensation programs
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	It is our philosophy to link executive compensation to corporate performance and to create incentives for management to enhance Company value.&#160; The following objectives have been adopted by the Compensation Committee as guidelines for compensation decisions:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="4728DCB2184D46A085BEFD37D76A8CCF" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	provide a competitive total executive compensation package that enables us to attract, motivate and retain key executives;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="28CB4105BA2847369BCC1887DCE326B6" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	integrate the compensation arrangements with our annual and long-term business objectives and strategy, and focus executives on the fulfillment of these objectives; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="8904C160DFB6410197DEA4088A3243EA" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	provide variable compensation opportunities that are directly linked with our financial and strategic performance.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Procedures for determining compensation
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Our Compensation Committee has the overall responsibility for designing and evaluating the salaries, incentive plan compensation, policies and programs for our named executive officers.&#160; The Compensation Committee relies on input from our Chief Executive Officer regarding the named executive officers (other than himself), and on an analysis of our corporate performance.&#160; With respect to the compensation for the Chief Executive Officer, the Compensation Committee evaluates the Chief Executive Officer&#8217;s performance, sets his compensation and recommends it for approval to the independent members of the Board of Directors.&#160; In 2015, the Board of Directors approved the recommendations of the Compensation Committee for salary, bonus and the long-term equity award for the Chief Executive Officer.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	60
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage63"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Our Chief Executive Officer plays a significant role in the compensation-setting process of the other named executive officers and makes recommendations to the Compensation Committee concerning performance objectives and salary and bonus levels for the other named executive officers and executive team.&#160; The Compensation Committee, at least annually, then discusses the recommendations with the Chief Executive Officer.&#160; The Compensation Committee may, in its sole discretion, approve, in whole or in part, the recommendations of the Chief Executive Officer.&#160; The Compensation Committee approves the compensation for the named executive officers other than the Chief Executive Officer.&#160; In 2015, the Compensation Committee approved the Chief Executive Officer&#8217;s recommendations for salary, bonus and long-term equity awards for each of the other named executive officers.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Compensation Committee considers, among other aspects, our long-term and short-term strategic goals and development goals when evaluating our corporate performance as a factor for compensation decisions.&#160; In determining the adjustments to the compensation of our named executive officers, we considered data from the Radford Global Life Sciences Survey of compensation, which consists of aggregated, non-company specific data on executive compensation on an industry basis. The Compensation Committee used information obtained from this survey, its assessment of the roles and performance of the named executive officers, and the experience of its members with other public companies, as well as the recommendations of the Chief Executive Officer to inform and guide its compensation decisions for 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	At the 2015 annual meeting of shareholders, shareholders holding approximately 85% of the votes cast approved, on an advisory basis, the compensation paid to our named executive officers for 2014.&#160; Shareholders holding approximately 81% of votes cast also approved the increase in the number of shares under our 2002 Stock Incentive Plan, as amended (the &#8220;Stock Plan&#8221;).&#160; The Compensation Committee factored into its decisions for 2016 compensation decisions the results of these 2015 say-on-pay votes, and the support of the increase in the number of shares available under the Stock Plan, as the Company relies on the availability of stock available for long-term equity-based awards in compensating the named executive officers while conserving cash for the business.&#160; We will continue to monitor the annual say-on-pay results and include such results in our annual executive compensation analysis.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Elements of compensation
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The compensation of our named executive officers consists primarily of four major components:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="1FD82595248745B8801FF8C5EDF942D0" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	base salary;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="076906E8455C462C86B25579A7977219" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	annual incentive awards;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="9AB2F7161C8449AC95B013BBA0BD0CA1" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	long-term equity awards; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="E0152D4134CF422C88972CAA1DE1ED79" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	other benefits.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Base salary
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The base salary of each of our named executive officers is determined based on an evaluation of the responsibilities of that particular position, each named executive officer&#8217;s historical salary earned in similar management positions with the Company or other companies, and a review of the Radford compensation survey described above.&#160; A significant portion of each named executive officer&#8217;s total compensation is in the form of base salary.&#160; The salary component is designed to provide the named executive officers with consistent income and to attract and retain talented and experienced executives capable of managing our operations and strategic growth.&#160; Annually, the performance of each named executive officer is reviewed by the Compensation Committee using information and evaluations provided by the Chief Executive Officer with respect to the other named executive officers and its own assessment of the Chief Executive Officer, taking into account our operating and financial results for the year, a subjective assessment of the contribution of each named executive officer to such results, the achievement of our strategic growth and any changes in our named executive officers&#8217; roles and responsibilities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	61
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage64"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Annual incentive plan
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The named executive officers participated in the Company&#8217;s annual incentive plan for senior management (the &#8220;Incentive Plan&#8221;) for 2015.&#160; Under the Incentive Plan, management of the Company develops annual corporate goals and milestone objectives that are then approved by the Compensation Committee and the Board of Directors.&#160; The Incentive Plan is designed to recognize and reward our employees, including the named executive officers, for contributing towards the achievement of our annual corporate business plan.&#160; These annual incentive awards are designed to reward near-term operating performance and the achievement of milestones critical to the Company&#8217;s success in both the near and the long-term.&#160; The Compensation Committee believes the Incentive Plan serves as a valuable short-term incentive program for providing cash bonus opportunities for our employees upon achievement of targeted operating results.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	The 2015 Incentive Plan was 30% weighted on goals related to the interactions with the FDA with respect to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 and pre-submission activities related to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2, 30% on
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2-related development milestones, 10% on an EU sales goal and 20% on successful advancement of an appendicitis asset monetization transaction. The remaining 30% of the 2015 Incentive Plan goals was related to advancement of the strategic alternative, which was the negotiation of the Strand transactions.&#160; A potential stretch goal for 2015 included receipt of 510(k) clearance for
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	For 2015, based upon a review of the goals and achievements, the Compensation Committee and the Board of Directors determined that the target 2015 Incentive Plan goals were fully achieved except for the EU sales revenue goal and the stretch goal was not achieved, and approved 2015 annual incentive bonus payments at the 90% level.&#160; The bonuses earned for 2015 were paid in early 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Long-term equity awards
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Compensation Committee believes that it is essential to align the interests of the executive officers of the Company who meet the definition of &#8220;named executive officers&#8221; under the federal securities laws with the interests of our shareholders, and believes the best way to accomplish this alignment is through awards of long-term, equity-based compensation. The Compensation Committee has also identified the need to recruit and retain experienced, high performing executives, and equity-based awards assist in such recruitment and retention. Such awards are made under the Stock Plan.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Company has granted stock options as incentive stock options in accordance with Section 422 of the Code, subject to the volume limitations contained in the Code, as well as non-qualified stock options. Generally, for stock options that do not qualify as incentive stock options, the Company is entitled to a tax deduction in the year in which the stock options are exercised equal to the spread between the exercise price and the fair market value, at the time of exercise, of the stock for which the stock option was exercised. The holders of the non-qualified stock options are generally taxed on this same amount in the year of exercise. For stock options that qualify as incentive stock options, the Company does not receive a tax deduction, and the holder of the stock option may receive more favorable tax treatment than he or she would for a non-qualified stock option. Historically, the Company has primarily granted incentive stock options to provide these potential tax benefits to its executives and because of the limited expected benefits to the Company of the potential tax deductions as a result of its historical net losses.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Board of Directors made annual stock option awards to the named executive officers in January 2015.&#160; The named executive officer annual awards for stock options, other than the Chief Executive Officer, are generally awarded at the same level for each named executive officer based on a percentage of salary.&#160; The grant date value of awards made to the named executive officers for 2015 are included in &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Executive Compensation - Summary Compensation Table
</FONT>
	&#8221; and a description of the awards is included in &#8220;-
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Outstanding Equity Awards at Fiscal Year End
</FONT>
	&#8221; table.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Company has adopted a Change in Control policy for the Stock Plan.&#160; A &#8220;Change in Control&#8221; is defined under the Stock Plan as (i) the acquisition, directly or indirectly, by any person or group (within the meaning of Section 13(d)(3) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934) of the beneficial ownership of more than fifty percent of the outstanding securities of the Company, (ii) a merger or consolidation in which the Company is not the surviving entity, (iii) the sale or transfer or other disposition of all or substantially all of the assets of the Company, (iv) the complete liquidation or dissolution of the Company, or (v) any reverse merger in which the Company is the surviving entity but in which securities possessing more than fifty percent of the total combined voting power of the Company&#8217;s outstanding securities are transferred.&#160; Under the adopted policy, in the event of a Change in Control, all outstanding unvested stock options and rights granted under the Stock Plan and held by directors and named executive officers will fully vest.&#160; The Board of Directors believes that this acceleration of vesting of outstanding awards provides the named executive officers at risk for job loss in any Change of Control with certainty as to the impact of the Change in Control on such long-term compensation.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Compensation Committee periodically reviews long-term incentives to assure that our executive officers and other key employees are appropriately motivated and rewarded in a way that is aligned with our long-term financial results.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	62
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage65"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Other benefits
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Perquisites and other benefits
</FONT>
	- We offer our named executive officers modest perquisites and other personal benefits that we believe are reasonable and in our best interest and generally in line with benefits we offer to all of our employees. See &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Executive Compensation&#8212; Summary compensation table
</FONT>
	.&#8221;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Severance benefits
</FONT>
	- We have entered into employment agreements with each named executive officer. These agreements provide our named executive officers with certain severance benefits in the event of involuntary termination. See &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Executive Compensation
</FONT>
	&#8212;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Employment agreements and post&#8209;employment benefits.
</FONT>
	&#8221;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Pension benefits -
</FONT>
	The Company has no defined benefit plans, supplemental executive retirement plans or actuarial plans.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Nonqualified defined contribution and other deferred compensation plans
</FONT>
	- The Company does not have a defined contribution plan and has not contributed to a deferred compensation plan.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	2015 Named Executive Officer Compensation
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In January 2015, the Company announced that it had received a &#8220;not substantially equivalent&#8221; letter from the FDA with respect to its 501(k) submission for its
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 product candidate.&#160; Since that time, the Board of Directors has directed management to focus on evaluating the possibility of modifying the intended use for
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1, with possible re-submission to the FDA, sales of its CE-mark approved
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	1 products in the European Union, the Company&#8217;s
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	APPY
</FONT>
	2 product development efforts, and considering other corporate transaction alternatives to possibly acquire or gain access to assets beyond the Company&#8217;s core focus of appendicitis diagnostic development and commercialization.&#160; In establishing the incentive goals for 2015, the Compensation Committee has focused on these activities.&#160; In addition, the Compensation Committee and the Board has approved a retention program for the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer of the Company.&#160; The Compensation Committee and the Board of Directors, in approving such retention program, focused on the importance of and need to retain the services of such named executive officers in pursuing such corporate activities.&#160; Such retention program continues the current employment agreements with Messrs. Lundy and McGonegal without change, ties a portion of the 2015 incentive goals to successful execution of a corporate transaction, and establishes the potential for a retention bonus, equal to 50% of base salary to be paid to such named executive officers upon the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	consummation of a corporate transaction.&#160; Because of termination of the Strand transaction, no retention bonus will be paid relative to the Strand transaction.&#160; The continuation of the current employment agreements would provide additional severance benefits, as described below, if either named executive officer&#8217;s employment is terminated in connection with a change in control.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>

	(1)

<FONT ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 5.14PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Effective January 1, 2015, Mr.&#160;Lundy's annual salary was increased to $382,525.&#160; Mr.&#160;Lundy also serves as a director of the Company; he does not receive additional compensation for serving in such role. Amounts included in &#8220;All Other Compensation&#8221; include: temporary living and travel accommodations he was provided at a total cost of $33,873 and $27,774 in 2015 and 2014, respectively, and coverage under the Company&#8217;s group medical plan at a total cost of $10,133 and $12,308 in 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">

</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Options Exercised and Stock Vested
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	None of the named executive officers exercised stock options during the year ended December 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Employment Agreements
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Company has entered into employment agreements with, and provides post-employment benefits to, its named executive officers as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Chief Executive Officer
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	On March 24, 2010, we entered into an employment agreement with Mr.&#160;Lundy, which provides that he serves at the pleasure of the Board of Directors unless the agreement is terminated by either party as provided in the agreement. The agreement provides in the event that Mr.&#160;Lundy&#8217;s employment is terminated by the Company for other than cause, or if such employment is terminated by the executive in the event of a change in control, severance payments based upon Mr.&#160;Lundy&#8217;s salary will be made for twelve months.&#160; In the event of death or disability, severance payments based upon Mr.&#160;Lundy&#8217;s salary will be made for three months.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Chief Financial Officer
</FONT>
	- On February 2, 2009, we entered into an employment agreement with Mr.&#160;McGonegal, which provides that he serves at the pleasure of the Board of Directors unless the agreement is terminated by either party as provided in the agreement. The agreement provides in the event that Mr.&#160;McGonegal&#8217;s employment is terminated by the Company for other than cause, or if such employment is terminated by the executive in the event of a change in control, severance payments based upon Mr.&#160;McGonegal&#8217;s salary will be made for six months.&#160; In the event of death or disability, severance payments based upon Mr.&#160;McGonegal&#8217;s salary will be made for six months.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	&#160;

	__________
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 5.14PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Under the Change in Control Policy approved by the board of directors, upon consummation of a Change in Control (as defined in the Stock Plan) any unvested stock options held by a named executive officer accelerate and vest upon the consummation of a Change in Control.&#160; This column shows the value of unvested stock options that would have been received upon acceleration of unvested stock options as of December 31, 2015.&#160; The closing price of the Company&#8217;s Common Stock on December 31, 2015 was $0.30 per share; therefore no value was added for stock options outstanding.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Director Compensation
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Since February 1, 2008, each non-employee director receives cash compensation of $1,000 per month.&#160; On October 7, 2010, upon becoming non-executive Chair of the Board of Directors, Gail S. Schoettler began receiving cash compensation of $2,000 per month.&#160; To conserve cash, each non-employee director agreed to defer receipt of 50% of the cash compensation for the months of February through June 2012, resulting in a total deferral of $5,000 for Gail S. Schoettler and $2,500 each for the remaining directors.&#160; The deferrals were paid in June 2015.&#160; Our non-employee directors typically receive a stock option award upon joining and additional options over time, generally annually.&#160; As additional compensation for service as non-executive chair, Ms. Schoettler receives awards equal to 1.5 times the awards made to the other non-employee directors when such awards are made.&#160; The directors are also reimbursed for all expenses incurred by them in attending board and committee meetings.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<EFX_SECURITY_OWNERS>
<A NAME="FIS_SECURITY_OWNERS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<A NAME="APPY_10K-123115_HTM_ITEM12_">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	ITEM 12.&#160;&#160;SECURITY OWNERSHIP OF CERTAIN BENEFICIAL OWNERS AND MANAGEMENT AND RELATED STOCK HOLDER MATTERS.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The number of shares of Common Stock outstanding at the close of business on February 1, 2016 was 30,990,029.&#160;&#160;The following table sets forth the beneficial ownership of Common Stock as of February 1,&#160;2016 by each director and each named executive officer then serving, by all directors and named executive officers as a group, and by each person who owned of record, or was known to own beneficially, more than 5% of the outstanding shares of Common Stock.&#160;&#160;Beneficial ownership is determined in accordance with Rule 13d-3 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.&#160;&#160;In computing the number of shares beneficially owned by a person or a group and the percentage ownership of that person or group, shares of Common Stock subject to options and warrants currently exercisable or exercisable within 60 days after February 1, 2016 are deemed outstanding, but are not deemed outstanding for the purpose of computing the percentage ownership of any other person.&#160;&#160;To the knowledge of the directors and executive officers of Venaxis, as of February 1, 2016, there are no persons and/or companies who or which beneficially own, directly or indirectly, shares carrying more than 5% of the voting rights attached to all outstanding shares of the Company, other than as set forth below.&#160;&#160;Unless otherwise indicated, the address of each individual named below is the address of the Company, 1585 South Perry Street, Castle Rock, Colorado 80104.
</DIV>

<EFX_OFFICER_TRANSACTIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_OFFICER_TRANSACTIONS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	ITEM 13.&#160;&#160;CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED TRANSACTIONS, AND DIRECTOR INDEPENDENCE.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Except for the employment agreements previously entered into between the Company and certain of its named executive officers (as described in Item 11 above), since January 1, 2015, none of the directors or named executive officers of the Company, nor any person who owned of record or was known to own beneficially more than 5% of the Company&#8217;s outstanding shares of its Common Stock, nor any associate or affiliate of such persons or companies, has any material interest, direct or indirect, in any transaction, or in any proposed transaction, which has materially affected or will affect the Company.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Information about the independence of our non-employee directors and the composition of the Audit Committee and Compensation Committee is set forth in Item&#160;10, &#8220;Directors, Named Executive Officers, and Corporate Governance&#8221; herein.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	During 2014 the Company executed services agreements (Phase I and Phase II) with SomaLogic, Inc. (&#8220;SomaLogic&#8221;) for SomaLogic to perform research services for the Company. The research encompassed analyzing biological samples.&#160; Under the agreements research services totaling $379,344, were completed and paid in 2014. No services were performed by SomaLogic for the Company in 2015. The agreements provide for additional sample processing totaling approximately $95,000, should the Company elect to do run them. As of December 31, 2015 and 2014, no amounts were due to SomaLogic.&#160; A member of the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors serves as the Chief Medical Officer for SomaLogic and during the Venaxis Board of Director&#8217;s consideration of the SomaLogic agreements, that Director recused himself from the considerations and vote.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	71

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Audit fees in 2015 and 2014 relate to the financial statement audits and the quarterly reviews.&#160; Audit fees in 2014 also include assistance with the filing of registration statements on Forms S-1, S-3 and S-8.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Our principal accountant (through its full time employees) performed all work regarding the audit of our financial statements for the most recent fiscal year.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The Company&#8217;s Audit Committee currently has a policy in place that requires its review and pre-approval of all audit and permissible non-audit services provided by its independent auditors.&#160; These services requiring pre-approval by the Audit Committee may include audit services, audit related services, tax services and other services.&#160; All of the services performed by the independent registered public accounting firm were approved by the Company&#8217;s Audit Committee and prior to performance. The Audit Committee has determined that the payments made to its independent accountants for these services are compatible with maintaining such auditors&#8217; independence.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5.12%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 94.88%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP" COLSPAN="3">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 94.88%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP" COLSPAN="3">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5.12%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 94.88%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP" COLSPAN="3">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5.12%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 94.88%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP" COLSPAN="3">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officers and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5.12%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5.12%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	a)
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 89.76%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP" COLSPAN="2">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5.12%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5.12%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

	b)
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 89.76%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP" COLSPAN="2">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5.12%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#8217;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5.12%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 94.88%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP" COLSPAN="3">

	The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officers and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#8217;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#8217;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>

</DIV>

	&#160;

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	In connection with the Annual Report of Venaxis, Inc. (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2015 as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the &#8220;Report&#8221;), each of the undersigned Stephen T. Lundy and Jeffrey G. McGonegal, hereby certifies, pursuant to Section 1350 of Chapter 63 of Title 18 of the United States Code as adopted pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that:
</DIV>

<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
